fields.summary: Jira Mobile: Allow for links to be clicked and javascript/jquery to be supported if using an MDM

fields.description:
Currently, the mobile apps from Atlassian use a non-standard browser user agent that is identified as AtlassianMobileApp and the request is that the app be built using a Standard browser user agent that supports Javascript/JQuery.

This is to resolve Issues with the SAML SSO within the Mobile app due to non-standard user agent support or coding like JQuery.

When a user goes through the application and tries to Authenticate, the application automatically re-directs the user to our SAML Identity provider. The SAML provider requires that the application support Javascript/JQuery in order for the application to authenticate properly. In customer case, they use a method called P2A (Push 2 Authenticate) and presents the user a letter or number. This requires the use of the SecureAuth Authenticate application. If a user authenticates with the SecureAuth application, the user is presented with the message of "Unfortunately, an access issue has occurred. Your session may have timed out or you may have started from and incorrect favorite."  (attaching an image of this error)

There is a way to select another option when the current method does not work by clicking on a link in the Authentication flow with the message: "Didn't recieve your PIN? Try another delivery method" However, when the link is clicked in the authentication flow, within the Confluence server or Jira server mobile app, the link is not activated and does not re-direct. (attaching an image of this error)

Customer Identity team identified that the application user_agent is coming through as AtlassianMobileApp and the SecureAuth application requires a standard user agent that is supported by major browsers on mobile devices and will execute js files. Users are able to login to Jira or Confluence via a browser without issue, but that defeats the purpose of the mobile app.
fields.summary: Requesting the Atlassian Mobile applications be built using a Standard browser user agent instead of currently identifying itself as an AtlassianMobileApp user agent which is non-standard.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

One of the reasons why a Jira System Administrator removes the *Extended Project Administration* permission/feature is to prevent other users associated with the project from editing its workflows, and this is supported by the usage of the following article available in our documentation:
 * [Project Permissions Overview - Extended project administration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/managing-project-permissions-1027137825.html#Managingprojectpermissions-Extendedprojectpermissions]

This permission allows users to edit a project's workflows under certain conditions. However, with this feature *disabled*, a user that has been inserted into the *Administrators* role for this project and is listed as a *Board Administrator* still is able to alter the *Simplified Workflow* of the board (if it is being used), causing the *project's workflow* to be altered in this process.

Even though, this information is properly listed in the *Benefits of using the Simplified 
 Workflow* section of the documentation article associated with *Simplified Workflows*:
 * [Using the Simplified Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/using-the-simplified-workflow-938845286.html]

We can find a quote from the article below:
{quote} * Can be edited via the board configuration (see Adding a new status on the [Configuring columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-columns-938845277.html] page), provided that you are the project administrator for the project that is on the board.{quote}
This can lead to confusion, as this feature can allow these users to alter the project's workflows, by altering the board's column configuration. Therefore, we should update our documentation article ([Managing Project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/managing-project-permissions-1027137825.html]) to address this situation and to better inform our customers of this use-case. Having that said, we need to be more explicit under conditions this feature is not valid for *Simplified Workflows*, to prevent this confusion.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample Scrum or Kanban project, which will be created with a simplified workflow.
 # Disable the Extended permissions for the project.
 # Go to the board configuration. # Create a new status or new column.
 # This will create a new step on the project Simplified workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The [Managing Project permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/managing-project-permissions-1027137825.html] would accurately outline this exception.
h3. Actual Results

There are no mentions to these conditions.
h3. Workaround

Prevent the boards associated with the project from using *Simplified Workflows*.
fields.summary: Extended permissions documentation fails to mention that users simultaneously listed as Board and Project Administrators are able to modify the project's Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you are using a Simplified Workflow, you can create a *status* and/or *columns* if you have both the *Project Admin* and *Board Administrator* role, which reflects on the project Workflow. However, whenever a simplified workflow is altered, no entries are included in the Audit Log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample Scrum or Kanban project, which will be created with a simplified workflow.
 # Disable the *Extended permissions* for the project
 # Go to the board configuration.
 # Create a new status or new column.
 # Go to the Audit log and try to find any workflow change.

h3. Expected Results
 # As the workflow was altered, an entry should be inserted in the Audit Log.

h3. Actual Results

From the Audit Log page, you can't find any entry about the workflow/status change.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Changing a Simplified Workflow by altering a board's column configuration does not generate any entries in the Audit log.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Anonymizer tool had a bug which is workarounded by new parameters.
These new parameters were added to https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/sending-jira-data-to-support-147216.html but not to https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymising-jira-application-data-938847706.html

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymising-jira-application-data-938847706.html

h3. Expected Results
Command should be
{noformat}
$ java -DentityExpansionLimit=2147480000 -DtotalEntitySizeLimit=2147480000 -Djdk.xml.totalEntitySizeLimit=2147480000 -Xmx2g -jar joost.jar <JIRA BACKUP>.xml anon.stx > <NAME OF ANONYMISED BACKUP>.xml
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
Command is
{noformat}
$ java -Xmx512m -jar joost.jar <Jira BACKUP>.xml anon.stx > <NAME OF ANONYMISED BACKUP>.xml
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Jira administrators' should get notified when a user requests "*Browse Project*" permission for a project for which they don't have permission.

NOTE: this is currently available in confluence [How does "Request access" work in Confluence?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-does-quot-Request-access-quot-work-in-Confluence/qaq-p/433276]  and seems to be related to an existing feature request : [Option for users to request project access directly to project Lead|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-59366]
fields.summary: when a user sends a request for "Browse project" permission the jira administrators should get notified.

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow unauthenticated remote attackers to view custom field and custom SLA names via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the mobile site view.

 

The affected versions are before version 8.13.2, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.14.1.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.13.2
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.14.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.13.2
 * 8.14.1
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Mobile site reveals the summary titles of privately linked tickets - CVE-2020-36235

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It should show group picker in editing group members of project role, when click group picker icon. However,  the user picker is shown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # JIRA ADMINISTRATION > System > Project role 
 # Select a role , and click 'Manage Default Members'
 # Click 'Edit' of Default Groups
 # Click the icon of group picker

h3. Expected Results

The group picker popup window is shown.
h3. Actual Results

The user picker popup window is shown.
h3. Workaround

Input the group name directly, instead of using group picker to choose.
fields.summary: User Picker is shown instead of Group Picker while editing group members of a project role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
dialogContentReady is fired before all content is ready to be consumed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the issue in Jira (i.e. <base_URL>/browse/TEST-2).
# Open developer tools, go to "Console", put the following line in there:
{noformat}
AJS.$(document).bind("dialogContentReady", function(e, dialog) {if(AJS.$("#sd-comment-tabs").length === 0) {console.log("The comment tabs do not exist yet!");}else {console.log("The comment tabs are here, as they should be!");}});
{noformat}
# Click the "Assign" button on the top of the page. An assign dialog will open.
# 
h3. Expected Results
Console prints: "The comment tabs are here, as they should be!".

h3. Actual Results
Console prints: "The comment tabs do not exist yet!"

h3. Workaround

Make the customization wait for a tick or watch for the asynchronous creation of the expected element to be ready before consuming it.
fields.summary: dialogContentReady is fired before all content is ready to be consumed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Calendar plugin doesn't comply to ISO8601

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Administration>System>Look and Feel* and scroll to the bottom
 # On the option *Use ISO8601 standards in Date Picker*, change to *yes*:
 !Date_Picker.PNG|thumbnail! 
 # Install the *Jira Calendar plugin* and add the *Jira Calendar gadget to a dashboard*
 # Observe that the week start from Sunday when it should start from Monday to comply to ISO8601:
 !Screenshot_2020-12-30_at_11_53_54.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Week should start from Monday as in previous Jira versions for the Calendar plugin
h3. Actual Results
Week start from Sunday and does not comply to ISO8601.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Calendar plugin doesn't comply to ISO8601

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
2020-12-30 15:45:07,431+0530 versioning-stats-0 INFO      [c.a.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerWithStats] [VERSIONING] snapshot stats: {"requestMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{"1":0,"5":0,"10":0,"50":0,"100":0,"200":0}},"requestCount":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{"1":0,"10":0,"100":0,"1000":0}},"requestPercent":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{"1":0,"3":0,"5":0,"10":0,"20":0,"30":0}},"incrementIssueVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"incrementCommentVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"incrementWorklogVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"incrementRelatedCommentVersionsMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"incrementRelatedWorklogVersionsMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"markIssueDeletedAndIncrementVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"markCommentDeletedAndIncrementVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"markWorklogDeletedAndIncrementVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getIssueVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getCommentVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getWorklogVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getRelatedCommentVersionsMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getRelatedWorklogVersionsMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"getLocalVersionsMillis":{"count":90,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{"1":90,"5":0,"10":0,"50":0,"100":0,"500":0,"1000":0}},"markEntityDeletedAndIncrementVersionMillis":{"count":0,"min":0,"max":0,"sum":0,"avg":0,"distributionCounter":{}},"cleanAllDeletedEntityVer fields.description:
Add: 'Last Updated' to the search functionality in the Search Filters

With multiple Favorites Filters used within Dashboards, if someone makes a breaking change to the database schema (such as renaming a field), these filters all have to be updated with the new name. To my knowledge, the only way I can do this is to go under 'Issues' and edit all of my Favorites one at a time.

It would be nice to be able to see which ones have been already updated (based on the updated date), and which ones I have yet to complete.

Another way in which the updated field could be helpful would be that it could allow someone to infer whether or not a particular filter has been actively used (if all others have been changed recently, but one has not). Also, if someone changed the filter recently that may have caused an unexpected change to the dashboard, at least this could be known. Ideally, both the updated date and the person to have last updated would be good, but at least the updated date could rule out an explicit change to the filter itself if trying to debug a problem with a Dashboard.
fields.summary: Additional searching field added to the Manager Filters - Search Filters

fields.description: On Jira 8.11, an enhancement for the Issue Detail View was implemented, making it optional. When this functionality is used (Board > Hide detail view), clicking on the issue doesn't show the Issue Detail, as expected. It would be a nice addition to be able to click on the issue key in the card and be redirected to the View issue screen.
fields.summary: Open the issue when clicking on the issue key of a card

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The screen keeps grayed out until click into it after canceling the grant permission pop-up in the permission schemes screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Administration (cog wheel)
 # Select Issues
 # Click on Permission Schemes
 # Select any permission scheme
 # Click on "Grant Permission" button
 # Click on "Cancel" button of the {{Grant Permission}} pop-up
 !image-2020-12-28-11-09-29-571.png|width=503,height=260! 
h3. Expected Results

Return back to the Edit Permission screen
 !image-2020-12-28-11-10-02-040.png|width=505,height=262!
h3. Actual Results

Edit Permission screen is grayed out
 !image-2020-12-28-11-07-40-787.png|width=532,height=274!

h3. Workaround

Click again into any part of the screen to reactivate it.
fields.summary: Canceling grant permission popup returns grayed screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Edit Issue Problem in adding attachments to the issue description in *Text Editor* using Google Chrome and Edge browsers. If we edit the description using text mode, then automatic exit from the edit mode occurs when adding an attachment. The issue is not reproducible in the Firefox browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try editing the issue description
 # Switch to Text Mode
 # Try to add attachments

h3. Expected Results

!Expected Results.png|width=635,height=399!

Attachment is added to the issue and the Edit window is retained to proceed further.
h3. Actual Results

!Actual Results.png|width=556,height=228!

Attachment is added to the issue and automatic exit from the edit description window occurs.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Edit issue : Text Editor automatically closes while adding attachments in text mode (Chrome and Edge browsers)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It's hard to discover a right custom field item for "User/Group Custom Field Value" in notification setting especially when multiple language is mixed. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-28 at 15.33.56.png|width=634,height=211!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a search functionality to put the value on that field.
fields.summary: Improvement on discoverability of User/Group custom field value in notification setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

"Add notification" UI doesn't allow multiple selection of the checkboxes that indicates who will receive the notification. e.g. "Current assignee" or "Reporter". 
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-28 at 15.13.13.png|width=508,height=261!
h3. Suggested Solution

Multiple selection should be available for these field.
fields.summary: "Add notification" configuration UI should allow multiple selection of user checkbox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project Admin -> Fields page shows Screens with the global admin style link, rather than the Extended project admin style link, even if Extended project admin is enabled
 * Actual link rendered: +/secure/project/ConfigureFieldScreen.jspa?id=SCREEN_ID+
 * Expected link to be rendered: +/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJ_KEY/screens/SCREEN_ID+

This means that the user will get sent to an authentication challenge, rather than to the project admin view of the screen. 

(i) Project Settings -> Screens renders the correct link
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user who has no global Jira Administrators access, but one who does have Project Admin access
 # On a project with Extended project administration enabled, visit Project Settings -> Fields
 # Find a field, and then click N Screens link
 # Click the screen that meets [Extended project admin criteria|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/managing-project-permissions-981154936.html#Managingprojectpermissions-Extendedprojectpermissions]

 
h3. Expected Results

The user is sent to the project admin edit page for the screen: +/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJ_KEY/screens/SCREEN_ID+ and is allowed to edit the screen
h3. Actual Results
 # The user is sent to the global admin only edit screen page: +/secure/project/ConfigureFieldScreen.jspa?id=SCREEN_ID+
 # Jira treats it as permission violation, and redirects the user to the login page, {{login.jsp}}

(!) There may be implications for Single Sign on, and could cause a potential redirect loop scenario
h3. Workaround

Do not edit screens via the *Project Settings -> Fields page*. Use *Project Settings -> Screens instead.*
fields.summary: Unable to edit screens via the Project Admin -> Fields link unless you are a global admin

fields.description: A Jira issue history is able to log when another issue is a added as sub-task/child, however if this sub-task is deleted, there is no record on parent history logs. This tracking could be added to improve user experience.
fields.summary: Issue history should track child issue/sub-task deletion

fields.description:
Related to [JRASERVER-43171|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43171]

h3. Problem description
According to [|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ms-team-integration-for-jira-privacy-and-data-processing-1026051892.html], Jira uses OAuth 1.0a to authenticate when using the Microsoft Teams for Jira plugin. 


h3. Suggested solution
Allow customers to use OAuth 2.0 instead, enabling a more secure connection.
fields.summary: Add support for OAuth 2.0 when configuring Microsoft Teams for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After setting a color for an Epic and refreshing the page, the color doesn't retain the same.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project Backlog
# Set a color to an Epic
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The Epic color gets updated

h3. Actual Results

After refreshing the page, the Epic color stays empty.

h3. Workaround

This issue seems to be caused for the Custom field name. When it called *Epic Color* instead of *Epic Colour*, it seems that Jira is not able to provide the correct *Search Template* and take it to *None*, instead of the necessary template.
To solve this:
# Stop Jira
# Unlock the *Epic Color* field using the guide here - [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
# Start Jira
# Go to Custom fields and search for the *Epic Color* field
# *Cog icon -> Edit*
# Change the *Search Template* to *Jira Software Epic Colour Searcher*
# Click on Update
# Test if it's working
# Lock the *Epic Color* field using the guide here - [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
fields.summary: Epic color doesn't keep after refreshing browser

fields.description:

To solve this:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the Manage apps, the warning banner displays a grey square instead of the close icon:

!Bug.png|width=548,height=272!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Install a clean Jira 8.14.0.
 # Step 2: Upload an incompatible plugin artifact.
 #Step 3: Refresh the screen and note that the banner with the missing closing button is present.

h3. Expected Results

The close icon would appear on the warning banner.
h3. Actual Results

A grey square appears instead of the close icon.

A .HAR file captured while accessing the page shows that a GET to /rest/plugins/1.0/io.aha.connect-key/media/plugin-icon returns a 404 HTTP code.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Missing close icon on Manage apps

fields.description:
Similar to JSDSERVER-3080, this request is for including the To/CC information at the bottom of the description of the newly created issue.

 

Ideally this would work like the existing feature for including the From information in the description:

[Created via e-mail received from: Display Name <address@email.com>]
fields.summary: Add recipient and CC information to description for issues created via mail handler

fields.description:
Related to JSDSERVER-1713, but this request is for the Jira mail handler feature.

 

In addition to the reason noted in that request, this would be beneficial for users who want historical information on who was in the To/CC line of the original message, without needing to set those as watchers on the issue.
fields.summary: Mail Handler should add original message as attachment on the newly created issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA is adding the Mail Server Address as a Watcher of an Issue when the E-mail Address belongs to some JIRA User and the Mail Handler has CC Watcher enabled. Leading to a possible Mail Loop.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Project and associate with the _Default Notification Scheme_;
 # Add an Incoming Mail Server and Add a Mail Handler that has the CC Watcher enabled
 # Create a user who has the same email address as the Incoming Mail Server
 # Send an e-mail to that address.
 # JIRA will create the issue and add the _Mail Server Address address as one of the watchers.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should not add the user in the watchers list.
h3. Actual Results

The user is added to the watchers list, leading to possible mail loop scenarios.
h3. Workaround

Modify the user email address.
fields.summary: Mail Server Address added as a Watcher when CC Watcher is on

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JQL search box size in the new versions of Jira is not optimised which is making it difficult to work in the smaller laptops
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * JQL search box in v8.2 >   !Screenshot 2020-12-21 at 9.15.54 PM.png|width=706,height=152,thumbnail!
 * JQL search box in v8.12, v8.13 >    !Screenshot 2020-12-21 at 9.16.27 PM.png|width=635,height=135!

h3. Expected Results

The search box is optimised to the screen
h3. Actual Results

The search box is smaller and which makes it difficult to work with smaller screened laptops/desktops.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL search box size in the new versions is not optimised

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we changed the language to "french" and then search for the number custom field like 1.0046463E72 then we see an error as given here "Value '1.0046463E72' for the 'number custom field' field is not a valid number"  but searching for the same number when language is changed to English does not give an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field "sfv" of a type number field
 # while creating a ticket enter the value ""Value '1.0046463E72'  for field "sfv"
# Try to search for this field using the advanced search. It works fine whe. profile language is set to English 
# Now change the language to french and search again and we see an error

h3. Expected Results
It should not give an error on searching for the fields when language settings is changed to french 

h3. Actual Results
It gives an error on searching for the fields when language settings is changed to french 

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The only workaround would be to change the language to "English" from the profile as it does not give an error
fields.summary: error "Value '1.0046463E72' for the 'PerID' field is not a valid number" on using JQL query  when language in changed to french

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Zero Downtime Upgrade process in Jira DC 7.x and 8.x is not adding the target version information in the *System Info* -> *Upgrade history*
h3. Environment

Jira Data Center 7.x and 8.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Install Jira Data Center 7.x or 8.x
 * Upgrade Jira DC to a newer version (following the document [Upgrading Jira Data Center with zero downtime|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-data-center-with-zero-downtime-938846953.html]
 * Under *System Info* > *Last Upgrade* click in the link *"Get more upgrade history details"* 

h3. Expected Results

Target version should be added in the Upgrade History
 (Database table {{upgradeversionhistory}})
h3. Actual Results

Target version is not added in the Upgrade History
 (Database table {{upgradeversionhistory}})
h3. Workaround

The SQL query below can be used to insert the missing values in the table "{{upgradeversionhistory"}}
 (!) The query was created for PostgreSQL and syntax may vary to other database vendors
 (!) Replace the '<UPGRADEDATE>','<TARGETBUILD>','<TARGETVERSION>' for the proper values
{code:sql}
INSERT INTO upgradeversionhistory (id, timeperformed, targetbuild, targetversion)
VALUES ((SELECT MAX(id)+1 FROM upgradeversionhistory),'<UPGRADEDATE>','<TARGETBUILD>','<TARGETVERSION>');{code}
fields.summary: Zero Down Time (ZDU) upgrades are not listed in System Info->Upgrade history
